4894dba38fb421c1a0eb6c275182d7e0 (16:56): Pom Pom Pom¬? all

d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (16:58): Hi! I wanna use suexec on my phpscripts. I followed all instructions of this howto: http://www.burghardt.pl/wiki/articles/php_suexec, but when i finished, and wanted to test out a php, i got internal server error.
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (16:58): 500 is Internal Server Error
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (16:59): In the error log i have this:  [error] (8)Exec format error: exec of 'teszt.php' failed.
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (16:59): that's always logged in the error log
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (16:59): yes, i know it, and still this line i have there: Premature end of script headers: teszt.php.
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (16:59): What does it means exactly?
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:00): or how can i solve it? The php contains only this: <?php system("id -a"); ?>
4d8600a2e648a1731ffe9d6c31ab1164 (17:02): zzz, are you running it as a CGI? you probably need to add the shebang on top
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:02): yango: Do You mean #!/usr/bin/phpX at the first line? I tried, but the same problem.
4d8600a2e648a1731ffe9d6c31ab1164 (17:03): oh, didn't see php_suexec stuff...
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:03): PHP should be presumed to be at fault until conclusively proven otherwise. And even thereafter, if it's convenient
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:03): yango: the only one difference in this case is the first log line missed in the error log, just the second appears.
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:09): No one has got idea for me? I tried out to send "Content type: text/html\r\n\r\n", but it still didn' t help.
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (17:12): Content-type, not Content type
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:17): ok, with Content-type works, but still runs under www-data ... .
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:30): Is there any support list for apache?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:37): zzz: Several. Looking for a user list?
add4f3a531f25e2f826dc5d53fa1ee70 (17:38): would it be theoretically possible to implement an upload scheme in some cgi/mod_* that supports resuming of uploads if it was stopped prematurely?
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:39): noodl: yes, i found <email/>, but i don' t this is the correct one i need.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:40): sven: No, I don't think that's possible.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:40): zzz: What's your question?
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:41): noodl: still the same, that suexec doesn' t work on my phpscripts.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:41): Presumably your php is running as cgi?
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:41): I don' t know whether You were here, i asked it for 20 minutes.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:42): Yes, I see. You're trying to run a php script as an executable it looks like
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:42): noodl: I don' t know. I bet yes, cuz i deleted php* modules from modules-enabled.
950459c20346abcb4cfcdefa53f410ee (17:43): i've got a curious problem. my apache2-installation seems to be unable to process more than 20 requests at once
950459c20346abcb4cfcdefa53f410ee (17:43): is that normal? if not, where can i modify that?
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:43): maxclients is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mpm_common.html#maxclients or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/mod/core.html#maxclients
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:44): noodl: but i' m interested in any way of running scripts under the user who owns the file.

1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:44): zzz: Find a better guide. I think you're missing something like an Action directive to call the php cgi binary. This is good, I hear: http://weblog.textdrive.com/article/36/trade-secret-1
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:45): i check it. moment.
950459c20346abcb4cfcdefa53f410ee (17:46): YES! that was it!!!!!! thank you so much!
950459c20346abcb4cfcdefa53f410ee (17:46): i've got a server which serves more than 1000 requests per seconds
950459c20346abcb4cfcdefa53f410ee (17:46): a double-opteron
950459c20346abcb4cfcdefa53f410ee (17:47): this restriction made him SORT OF slow! thanks a lot!!!!
d2f2297d6e829cd3493aa7de4416a18f (17:53): noodl: If i try to fill out SuexecUserGroup, i got back: bad user name.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:56): Perhaps the user id is out of range?
9b8a04982a967b1914dfc58bd6c719d7 (17:56): or maybe it's not a name?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:56): You should see the suexec docs for a long list of restrictions on suexec.
